sentences.english: Some of you might not agree with me here but seriously the chapters are a mess.
sentences.chinese: 你们可能不同意我的说法不过这些章节真的稀烂。

sentences.english: Tuotuo has given the face to chewing slowly; chewing was pulpy but hard to swallow.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱很给面子地慢慢嚼着，嚼得稀烂却难以下咽。

sentences.english: The second truck had its radiator completely smashed in .
sentences.chinese: 第二辆卡车的水箱也撞了个稀烂。
结果一般只能是砸个稀烂。

sentences.english: I couldn't get one in that crappy little town.
sentences.chinese: 我在那稀烂的小乡村没能找到一把可用的。

sentences.english: The beauty of this method is that you don't have to drop the barometer and break it.
sentences.chinese: 这个办法的好处是你不必把气压表扔下去，摔个稀烂。

definition: same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
(of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
